content.statement: pad-001-definition is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Peripheral-Arterial-Disease that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding pad-001-definition helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of pad-001-definition include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of pad-001-definition.

definitions_glossary.peripheral_arterial_disease: Atherosclerotic disease of non-coronary, non-cerebral arteries
definitions_glossary.ankle_brachial_index: Ratio of ankle to brachial systolic blood pressure
definitions_glossary.claudication: Muscle pain induced by exercise, relieved by rest, due to arterial insufficiency
definitions_glossary.critical_limb_threatening_ischemia: Chronic ischemia with rest pain, ulcers, or gangrene threatening limb viability
definitions_glossary.atherosclerosis: Inflammatory disease with lipid deposition and arterial wall thickening
definitions_glossary.intermittent_claudication: Cramping leg pain that occurs with walking and resolves with rest

epidemiology.gender: Equal overall; claudication more common in men

atypical_leg_symptoms.description: Leg fatigue, difficulty walking, nonspecific discomfort

classic_claudication.description: Reproducible muscle pain with exertion, relieved by rest

definition.@value: Atherosclerotic occlusive disease of peripheral arteries, primarily affecting the lower extremities, diagnosed by ABI ≤0.90

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Define peripheral arterial disease and its diagnostic criteria
Describe the clinical spectrum from asymptomatic to CLTI
Identify major risk factors for PAD
Understand PAD as a marker of systemic cardiovascular risk
Calculate and interpret the ankle-brachial index
common_errors: Missing asymptomatic PAD - remember to check ABI in high-risk patients
Treating PAD as just a leg problem - it's a cardiovascular disease marker
Equating PAD with claudication - most patients are asymptomatic
Not considering PAD in diabetic patients with 'neuropathic' foot ulcers
clinical_pearls: ABI <0.90 is diagnostic; <0.40 indicates severe disease
PAD patients die of heart attacks more than from leg problems
Every PAD patient needs aggressive cardiovascular risk modification
Walking exercise programs can double walking distance in claudicants

medicalCode.description: Atherosclerosis of native arteries of extremities
